RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was relieved.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Rich was successful in Alcoholics Anonymous and became a sponsor.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Dana felt flustered and pushed her feet away.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: June packed her bag and bought the ticket to Madrid.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: His mom left.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Missy vowed never to go back to the carnival again.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jim cooked the pizza as soon as he got home.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sheena felt great.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I loved my job so much more after that day.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He finally was able to be on time.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jane had little discipline.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Henderson's coffee shop was very successful.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sandy screamed and ran!

context: Sandy went into the kitchen to get something to drink. She kept hearing a rattling by the stove but couldn't see anything. She opened the fridge to get the pitcher of tea. About that time out pops the mouse from the stove.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Janey hated doctors.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I decided to go for a walk.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Florence never went fishing again.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Florence and her new friends went fishing again the next day.
context: Florence wanted to find something fun to do one afternoon. She decided to drive to the lake to go fishing. At the lake she met three other people who were also fishing. Although she did not catch a fish, Florence had a great time.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sarah's parents were upset and moved her curfew even earlier.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Sarah's parents were waiting for her with flowers and candy.
context: Sarah was out with her friends. She had been watching a movie at the theater. Sarah lost track of time and arrived back at home late. She missed her curfew by a few hours.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The man shouted at the boys that it was a good throw.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Tim and his friends ran before the man could see them.
context: Tim and his friends were standing on an overpass. They were chucking rocks at cars as they passed under the overpass. Usually they missed, but one time their rock shattered a windshield. The man pulled over and got out of his car.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The office worker began to sing a happy little tune.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The office worker knew it was going to be a long day.
context: An office worker booted up her computer. She intended to do her quarterly reports. No matter how much she clicked, though, she could not open programs. Despair settled over her like a pea-soup fog of misery.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She threw the teapot away.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She decided to give the teapot to her niece.
context: Old Aunt Margaret loved her tea pot. It had been in her family for three generations. Passed down from mother to daughter. Unfortunately Old Aunt Margaret didn't have any children.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Neil decided never to return to Romania.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Neil had a great time.
context: Neil loved visiting Romania! Transylvania was lovely even though he saw no vampires. But his favorite stop was Bucharest! The Romanian capital was vibrant and lively.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I hope my plants survive.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I hope my plants die.
context: I woke up today and realized the plants needed water. I went to the kitchen to retrieve the pail. After working a bit, I watered all of my plants. It might take a day or so but they'll look better.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Stacey had no pets.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Stacey decided they were just weird.
context: Stacey's cats were acting weird. They would run and hide randomly. She took them to the veterinarian to see what was wrong. They said both were perfectly healthy.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I hated the cat.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I decided to keep the cat.
context: I found a cat outside one day. I took her to the boat with me. I was planning on taking her to the shelter. However, I got very attached to her.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: My dad went to work.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The first girl was very upset.
context: My dad was dating a girl. The girl had a friend. The friend liked my dad. My dad eventually started to date the friend.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Betty was happy at management.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Betty was outraged and returned it.
context: Betty didn't like onions. She would order everything on a burger except onions. When she got back from the fast food place she opened her burger. It had onions on it.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She had a great time.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She decided to never play video games again.
context: Sue just bought a brand new computer. She wanted to play games on it. She downloaded her favorite game. She was so glad that it ran smoothly.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She agreed with him and sat calmly as he finished.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: By the end of it she was in tears and being held down.
context: Mary was near the end of a 2 hour dental procedure. The Novocaine was starting to wear off. She could feel her flesh being cut. But the dentist kept going insisting it was only pressure she felt.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Nita stripped down to her skivvies and ran outside that way.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Nita was pleased she could show off her costume and keep warm.
context: Nita had a perfect Halloween witch costume. But it was chilly out and she needed a jacket. She did not want to ruin her great costume with a plain jacket! She asked her mom for help, and her mom made her a blanket 'cloak'.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Melanie's house ended up burning down.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Melanie put the large fire out with her foot.
context: Melanie's smoke detector's alarm went off every time she made toast. She put up with the annoyance for two years. Finally, one day she decided to unplug the smoke detector. That very day, a real fire started in her apartment.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Joe fell over the edge.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Joe was glad that the sea was so calm that day.
context: Joe was working at a marina. The winds started to pick up and he could tell a storm was coming. He had to take his small boat to pick up some customers at sea. The storm started rocking his small boat violently.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Now they were awesome.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Everybody loved the hot dogs.
context: Mia was making brownies for a party. She just used a boxed mix. The brownies turned out pretty good. At the last minute, she added frosting to the top of them.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Kyle took the children shopping for a gift for their mother.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Now Matt and Kyle can go bowling more often.
context: Kyle invited everyone he works with out bowling one night. Most people couldn't go but Matt and John showed up. Matt had never been bowling before so they had to show him how to. After a few games, Matt picked up how to play pretty well.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He thought about her all day.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He felt relieved that he did not talk with her.
context: While sitting on the bus he saw her standing on the corner. Her beauty was like none he'd ever seen. As he walked off the bus he wondered if he should have pursued her. He slowly took the elevator to his tenth story office.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: We were relieved.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: We were furious that the boat came so close to our house.
context: It had been raining for days. The water came into the house and we couldn't pump it out in time. We moved up to the second floor but were afraid of the stagnant water. Eventually a rescue boat came by and got us.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jolene loved what she was given.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jolene was even more late.
context: Jolene was running late for work. She was speeding in her car. A policeman pulled her over. She was given a speeding ticket.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Natalie made friends very easily.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Natalie died a bitter crone, loved by no one.
context: Natalie went out of her way to make people unhappy. She wanted other people to be as unhappy as her. She primarily worked with petty insults. She made people self-conscious, and they left her alone.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I made a lot of money.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I lost a lot of money.
context: Year's ago I decided to start buying Investment Bonds. I completed the forms necessary for payroll withholdings. The deductions started immediately. In 2008 the economy went bust which caused the bonds to lose value.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Eve decided that she hated writing.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: They offered her a job.
context: Eve wrote short stories and published them online. She didn't make any money but enjoyed her hobby. One day, she saw an advertisement for freelance writing. She submitted one of her old published stories.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sam's sandals fell apart.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Sal loved the smell of sandalwood.
context: Sal scoured the jungle looking for the perfect sandal wood. He came across a perfect candidate tree! He cut it down and brought it to his shop. The sandals made from the tree were very high grade.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her friends noticed she was embarrassed and decided to comfort her.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She decided she would eat a sandwich for lunch.
context: Jackie was 11 and had to get braces. She was worried about what her friends would think. She tried to hide them when she first got them. Eventually her friends saw them and she was embarrassed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Alfred had a great time and was happy.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The barbecue did not go well.
context: Alfred had a barbecue with his friends. They all came and brought their favorite dish. When the food was ready, everyone sat down to eat together. The food was delicious and the company was great.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They gave in and agreed to buy Cody a car.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: His parents learned that Cody had been exaggerating.
context: Cody really wanted a smart phone. His parents said no, believing him to be too young. Cody protested that all of his friends had their own phones. His parents phoned some of the other parents.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was so disappointed that I missed the concert.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I was glad that I caught up on my sleep.
context: I was really excited about the Jimmy Buffett concert. My friend Jeff was going to come pick me up at 6 in the evening. But I was feeling sleepy, and took a little nap about 4 o'clock. When I finally woke up it was nearly 8 o'clock at night!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jen enjoyed her dinner with the judges.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jen surprised the judges with how well she sang.
context: This year the American Idol auditions came to Philadelphia. Since Jen only lived 2 hours away, she auditioned for the show. She arrived at the stadium among thousands of other contestants. Jen was so nervous when she stood in front of the judges.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I flattened it for my journal.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I burned it in a fire.
context: I found a flower in a field that I've never seen before. I took out my knife and cut the head off. I wrapped the head and put it in my bag. When I was home I dried out the flower head.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He was so happy.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He became very depressed.
context: Harry had a big crush on Mary. He asked her out on a date one evening. Mary told him that she wasn't interested. Harry was saddened by her response.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: John unraveled his scarf and threw it into the garbage.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: John decided to make more scarves in his spare time.
context: John was not looking forward to his social studies class. They were learning to knit scarves to make for the homeless. As the teacher taught them what to do, he realized it was fun. He finished a scarf in class.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Fanny is having a difficult time making friends.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Fanny enjoys her new school.
context: Fanny is new at school. She is from England. Many kids do not understand her accent. This made Fanny sad.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He decided to go to a fast food restaurant by himself.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He went to the restaurant with his girlfriend and had a nice meal.
context: Fred wanted to go somewhere nice with his girlfriend. He had already been saving for months to take her out to eat. He was going to take her to the most expensive restaurant in his city. He got dressed in his best clothes and went to pick her up.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I tripped and spilled a bowl of Halloween candy on the  porch.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: My mother said she thought mine was the oddest looking.
context: My brother and I always compete at carving Jack-o-Lanterns. We try to see who can carve the craziest face. I carved a face comprised entirely of different-sized squares. My brother carved a face in a strange spiral pattern.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Michelle then yelled at the man to let go of the mugger.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Michelle then went on a date with the man and fell in love.
context: Michelle was walking down the street. Then a man in a mask grabbed her purse and ran. Michelle did not know what to do so she yelled at him. A passerby stopped the criminal and held him down.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I apologized and turned it down.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I shut the door and turned it up.
context: I was listening to music last night. It was a great new song. I didn't realize how loud it was. The neighbors knocked on the door and asked to turn it down.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Iris purchased the wine.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Iris purchased a case of beer.
context: Iris was supposed to bring wine to dinner. She went to the liquor store. She browsed the wine selection. Then she found a great bottle of wine to bring.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was frustrated and scared about their lack of response.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I decided it was their problem and not to worry about it.
context: Today was the day that my online project was due. It consisted of a group assignment with three other members. It was my duty to organize an informative powerpoint. When I called them to email me their work, no one responded.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Harold left disappointed that his band never showed up.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Harold's feet hurt after the concert.
context: Harold wanted to see his favorite band in concert. When they finally came to town, he bought a ticket. He entered the concert hall and found a good place to stand. The band played for three hours.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Joe was happy to be having such a good day.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The cashier unhappily obliged.
context: All of the registers were full at the grocery store. Joe picked the shortest line and waited. When it was his turn he threw all his food on the belt. Joe barked at the cashier to scan his food quickly.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: John was happy to be at home.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: John decided to be a better boss.
context: John was a terrible boss. The workers decided to depose him. So they filed a complaint. Despite the complaint and following lawsuit John stayed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I decided to get a cat instead.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I found the puppy I wanted and brought her home.
context: I had always wanted to get a puppy. I finally felt I was ready to adopt one. A friend gave me the name and number for a breeder. I visited her to see the puppies available.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I laughed and asked for him to hit me harder.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Not wanting him to grab the belt back, I ran out of the house.
context: My mom remarried when I was five. She married an alcoholic who was physically and mentally abusive. He used to make me pick out a belt so that he could whip me. One day I grabbed the belt away from him as he was hitting me.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He knew his next bill would be lower.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He loved watching television.
context: Ray looked at his monthly power bill with anger. He went around his house and began to shut off extra lights. On his second trip around the house he unplugged extra electronics. Ray say in the darkness with satisfaction.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Dan bought his boat and spent the whole day sailing.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He spent all of the money on ice cream and pie.
context: Dan made up his mind that he would buy a boat by the end of the week. He spent the first few days checking out the closest dealerships. After the third day he found one he was interested in. On the fourth day he went to his bank to get a loan.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Marge treated Janet to dinner for trying to warn her.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Janet created an imaginary  brother and is institutionalized.
context: Janet wanted to convince her friend Marge that palm reading is bunk. She agreed to undergo a palm reading with Marge. The palm reader informed Janet that her brother was angry with her. Janet did not have a brother.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The restaurant manager apologized and gave her a gift card.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She decided it was a welcome addition and kept eating.
context: Stephanie went to her favorite restaurant. She ordered her usual sandwich. She bit into something crunchy and unusual. Upon inspection, she noticed the foot of a mouse in her sandwich.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Afterward,  Bobby and friends were covered in snow.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Their clothing was clean and dry at the end.
context: The snow had finally finished falling. Bobby and his friends rushed outdoors to play in it. They made snowmen, snowballs, and sledded. Finally, they decided on an all out snowball war.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He was so excited to finally have a drum set.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He decided not to play the drums anymore.
context: When Rod was eight he wanted to be a drummer. He would flip his mom's pans over and hit them. His parents had to put all the spoons out of his reach. After Years of wishing, his parents bought him a drum set.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Leopold found his iguana under the couch that evening.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Leopold does not miss his iguana.
context: Leopold's iguana went missing from his cage. Leopold looked everywhere and couldn't find the Iguana. Leopold thought the Iguana must have gotten outside. Leopold put up posters around his neighborhood.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I felt glad I won.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: It was a learning experience.
context: I visited Harvard Square in 2004. I watched the chess hustlers play speed chess. I put down $5 and played a game. I played 3 more games and lost $15.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She decided to be more careful when she skipped.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She skipped even faster and more recklessly after that.
context: Sally liked to skip. She skipped everywhere she went. She was skipping down the sidewalk one day. Sally tripped and fell down hard.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The man eventually died.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The man felt he could breath much better.
context: A man got very tired of being dripped on by his igloo. He built himself a new one out of dry ice. It solved his dripping problem. Unfortunately, dry ice sublimates into carbon dioxide gas.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ava started shaving right away.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ava was not happy with what her mother said.
context: Ava had hairy legs. She asked her mom if she could shave them. Ava's mom said she was probably old enough. Ava was so excited!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She was disappointed that she never finished.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She was pleased that she sold several copies.
context: Sasha loved writing from an early age. In her twenties she begins writing a novel and finishes it. Sasha decides to self-publish on amazon. Her book is sold through the kindle marketplace.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Agatha found the oven heat was too high.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Agatha found the oven was turned off.
context: Agatha loved to bake cookies. One day she put a batch in to bake. However, after twenty minutes, there was no scent of cookies baking. She went to see what had happened.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her son didn't know what she was talking about.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Her son had taken an egg from the ice box and put it in the nest.
context: Lacey had a bunch of chickens. One day, she realized one had laid an egg! She was so excited until she realized the egg was cold. She asked her son about it.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tom was very happy to now be surfing quickly.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Tom was glad his cable picture had improved.
context: Tom didn't know why his internet speed was so slow. He called his cable company but there were no problems. He finally decided to buy a new router. That made a huge difference.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Hannah loved the craft project.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Hannah was upset that she didn't get to eat scrambled eggs.
context: On Easter, Hannah wanted to dye some eggs with her children. The family sat around the table with the eggs and colors ready. She helped her daughter make a pink and yellow egg. She made herself a light blue egg.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: John hates Jessie.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jessie went to prom with John.
context: Jessie's friend John handed her a box of candy. She smiled, thanking him as she walked to her next class. Midway through she opened the box for a snack. Inside John had put a note asking her to prom.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He found his cat, but the cat didn't have the shoe.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He looked for his dog and then found his shoe.
context: Kevin was getting ready to leave for school in the morning. But he couldn't find his sneaker anywhere! He looked everywhere with no luck at all. Then he decided his dog had probably hidden the sneaker.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was relieved when I finally turned the essay in.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I hardly put any effort into writing the essay.
context: I once had to write an essay about war. I wrote it over the course of 5 days. It was difficult and in detail. It was hard to write about.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She then found them online and ordered them.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Amy then purchased them from the store.
context: Amy saw shoes online she wanted. She went to the local mall but they didn't have them in her size. She went to another mall to find them. They also didn't have them.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I suggested he apply to for a cook's position where I worked.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I told him I felt the same way.
context: My roommate made fish for dinner last night. Unfortunately, the fish was very bad. Even still, I ate it because he had worked so hard. When I was done, he told me he hated how the meal turned out.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Becky and her cousin both had copies of the book.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Her cousin then mailed her the book back.
context: Becky's grandmother had promised her a special book. It had been handwritten by her great-grandfather. When Becky's grandmother died, her cousin took the book! Becky was very angry and wrote her cousin a plaintive letter.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She gave him a five dollar tip.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She apologized to him.
context: Tay ordered a pizza delivered to her house. When it arrived, she reached for her wallet. She saw that she had just enough to pay for it. That left no money to tip the delivery boy!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Stevie was mad at his parents.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Stevie was able to buy a new skateboard.
context: Stevie wanted a new skateboard but didn't have enough money. He went around the neighborhood asking about odd jobs to do. He made a little bit of money but not enough for his new board. His parents were proud of him, so they pitched in for the rest.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Gina stood up and walked home.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She was sad that her friend's hadn't come to see her.
context: Gina waited outside the office before she had to go inside. She hoped her friends would come to see her before class began. The bell rang and the halls emptied. She went into the office and took a seat waiting to be called.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The people were trying to say hello to me.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I did not realize where my briefcase was.
context: One Christmas, I received a shiny and expensive-looking briefcase. The next day, I filled my new case and gathered  my things. I set the briefcase on the roof temporarily while I loaded car. While I was driving, people were beeping at me.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Martina fell to her knees and began to sob.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Martina was delighted.
context: Martina was the goalie for her soccer team. They were up tied in the 4th quarter. With the time running out the opposing team stole the ball. The player on the other team kicked and scored.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Soon she could walk along while holding on to furniture.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The baby cried because the dog ate her sandwich.
context: The baby had recently learned to crawl. She could crawl all over the living room floor. One day she crawled to the sofa and pulled herself upright. The next day she managed to pull herself up and stand for a second.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jim was extremely bored.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jim was glad he didn't have to miss work for jury duty.
context: Jim was summoned for jury duty. He had to call in to skip work. He arrived at the courtroom. He sat through the entire trial.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The supervisor gave him a raise.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The supervisor fired him.
context: Charles didn't take the advice of not dating girls one works with. He began dating his supervisor. His supervisor got jealous because Charles gave a coworker a ride. Charles' supervisor turned into his enemy.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Bill is a huge Broncos fan.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Bill thinks that the Bronco got lucky.
context: Bill bragged about the Patriots all year. He would make negative posts about other teams on Facebook. He would brag about every win they made. The Broncos beat the Patriots in the playoffs.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Nina was unable to control her addictions at all.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Nina was on the road to recovery.
context: Nina was trying to quit drinking. She decided to join a support group. She went to their meetings every week. In a few weeks she was handling her cravings much better.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Paul brought his mistress to the party.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mary forgave Paul.
context: Mary was pissed at Paul for forgetting their anniversary. Paul had to think quick. He decided to call his friends to help fix things. They helped him set up an amazing party and invited everyone.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Bob picked up all the nice things that his uncle left him.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Bob and his uncle went out for a nice steak.
context: Bob's uncle passed away a week ago. He got a call on a Monday afternoon from a lawyer. The lawyer told Bob that he had inherited some things. Bob got into his car and drove to the lawyer's office.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: At her first gig, she realized she never learned how to play.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She played small venues regularly and became well known.
context: Deirdra wanted to be a great blues musician. She listened to a lot of work by greats like BB King and Taj Mahal. She bought a guitar and tuned it for blues music. She booked a bar venue and started getting her work out there.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I went to the movies.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I began painting the rain.
context: It was raining very hard one day. It seemed like a bad idea to go anywhere, so I stayed indoors. I looked for something to do. I decided to set up my painting kit.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He enjoyed the weather.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He hated picnics.
context: Ted went for a drive one day. He drove all around town and looked at who was out and about. Then, he drove to a more remote place. He stopped, got out of his car, and ate a picnic lunch.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Joey loved everything about Disneyland except for Mickey Mouse.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Joey had a great time.
context: Joey went to Disneyland with his family. He was so excited to meet Mickey Mouse. When he met Mickey Mouse he was so excited he couldn't speak! Joey finally said hi to Mickey and it was great!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Gina now knows not to inhale the incense smoke.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gina was able to breath freely.
context: Gina's uncle burned incense all day long. Gina liked the scent. She leaned in close and took a big whiff. The smoke made her choke.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Samantha looked around and left.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Samantha bagged the poop.
context: Samantha went to the park in the morning. She went to walk her dog. Her dog pooped on the grass. Samantha forgot to carry a plastic bag.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Peter used his two dollars to buy shaving cream.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Peter bought noodles.
context: Peter was very hungry. He only had two dollars in his bank account. He decided to go to the grocery store. Luckily, noodles were on sale for less than two dollars.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Pam gave up trying to trim Archie's claws.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Pam gave Archie some food in an attempt to calm him down.
context: Pam tried to trim Archie's claws. She tried holding him all different ways. He didn't want them clipped at all! Finally she thought of something that would work.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Larry was bruised after a while.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Larry hated sandwiches.
context: Larry spent a long time finding a spot to put up his hammock. He spent even longer actually putting it up. After it was up he tried laying in it. He kept falling out, though.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He took his shoes off as soon as he could.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He wore them after school.
context: Larry bought new shoes last week. He wore them for the first time to school. Unfortunately they weren't broken in and really hurt. He was in pain all day.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: At the end of their date, Sue thought Bill was a nice guy.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: After their date, Robert and Sue decided to have a second one.
context: Robert had a crush on Sue. Sue had a crush on Robert. Robert asked Sue on a date. She agreed to go.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I drove past the theater and went back home.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I enjoyed the movie very much.
context: I wanted to do something fun. I found an interesting movie online. I saw that it was playing in a local theatre. I decided to go see it.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Teresa was so grateful she gave Miles a kiss right on the spot.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Teresa decided to sell the pandas Miles gave her.
context: Miles knew his girlfriend, Teresa, loved pandas. He devised a plan to give her the perfect birthday gift. He spent his whole week making stuffed pandas for her. When her birthday came, he gave them to her.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Bob drove home right after he made it to his parent's house.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: With the bumper in his trunk, Bob made it to his parent's house.
context: Bob had to drive to his parents house to make it home for Thanksgiving. There was a huge snowstorm brewing. Bob ran into a pile of snow on the highway. The front bumper came off on his car.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Samantha was so disappointed!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: When Amy went home, she resented the doctor.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Amy actually grew up to be a successful doctor.
context: Amy was scared of going to the doctor. The pediatrician was very patient with her and shared her stethoscope. Amy found it very interesting and wasn't scared anymore. Amy decided she wanted to be a doctor when she grew up.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He won the contest.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gomez is ashamed of what he has done.
context: Gomez loves Halloween. He wanted to enter a costume contest. For his costume, he decided to be Mickey Mouse. The contest had a Disney theme.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: His veggies grow large and plentiful.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He is happy the weeds grow.
context: Jack has a big garden. He weeds it every day. Once a week he takes veggies to the market. Jack waters his garden in the morning.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Amy was allowed to carry whatever she wanted to.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Amy explained the situation and moved on.
context: As Amy stood in line at security she realized she hated airports. She placed her purse into the bin and walked through. The TSA agent asked her to step to the side. Amy had forgotten to remove her mace from her key chain.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She got up and drove her car to work.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She set her alarm for 15 minutes earlier.
context: Debra decided that the bus was the most economical way to get to work. Debra found the bus somewhat slow, but very cost-effective. Debra also liked that public transit was environmentally friendly. She had to get up fifteen minutes earlier to make it to the bus.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Then I went out and built a snowman.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Sadly I had to skip building a snowman.
context: I really wanted to make a snowman last week. There was plenty of time and snow. Unfortunately I didn't have any gloves good enough. I had lost all the pairs that wouldn't soak through.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tom found an empty and haunted house.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Tom walked into a surprise birthday party.
context: Tom was delivering newspapers on his bike. It went smoothly until he arrived at this abandoned street. A house was empty but the door was open. Tom went inside of the house.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mary decided to visit the orchard and pay them.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mary decided to visit the orchard and steal another apple.
context: When Mary was a child, her class visited an apple orchard. Hungry Mary snuck off behind some bushes to eat an apple she picked. Years later, she felt guilty because she had not paid for the apple. Though a relatively trivial matter, it weighed on her conscience.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was happy as the car warmed up.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The a/c felt nice on a hot day.
context: I went to trade in my car. I wanted something nice. I found a good car for good price. As I left, I turned on the a/c.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Lisa decided to eat a hotdog instead.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Lisa had a great time babysitting with her friend.
context: Lisa wanted to go to her friends house. Her mother had to run errands and need her to watch the kids. She could only go if she took them with. Her mother gave her $10 to babysit and left.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Cassidy became good at baking scones.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Cassidy moved away.
context: Cassidy always loved eating scones at the shop near his home. He decided to try baking scones at home. At first his scones came out too try. However, he kept baking new batches until they were delicious.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: His clothes got completely soaked.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He was happy it rained.
context: As Archie was walking home, he noticed the sky was getting dark. He decided to run home instead of walk. The rainy started to pour. Archie couldn't run home fast enough.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mellie found there were shadows in the curtains.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mellie was looking forward to meeting any spirits.
context: Mellie thought she had seen a ghost. She looked all over her house with a flashlight to find the source. Finally, she saw the ghost again. She worked up the courage to turn on the lights.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: George decided to spend the money on a new hat instead.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Eventually, George was able to pay the ticket.
context: George had to go to court. He had to pay a parking ticket. He arrived at his local city council. He waited in line.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I went on about my day.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She gave me her number.
context: Last week I ran into the cutest girl ever. We were both at the grocery store and our eyes met. I mustered up the courage to ask for her number. She said no.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Pam finally bought the house.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Pam became homeless.
context: Pam was looking for a house to buy. After a few months of looking, she finally found a house she loved. However, it was a little too expensive. Pam tried to talk down the price, and succeeded.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She felt as if she had drank five cups of coffee.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She didn't wake up until the plane landed.
context: Candy was nervous about her upcoming airplane trip. Her sister gave her some sleeping pills to help her relax. Candy hated taking pills, but once on the plane, she felt differently. She was too nervous and took the pills despite herself.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The family thought Ted was very nice.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The family thought Ted was very rude.
context: Ted was seated at the bench at the airport, awaiting his flight. A family approach Ted and asked him if he could watch something. They asked him to watch a large box while they looked for their kid. Ted apologized and got up quickly and walked away.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He couldn't remember where he parked his car in the parking lot.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He knew there were severe consequences for shoplifting.
context: A young man went to buy a shirt. He searched through several aisles. He found a shirt he liked. Of course he paid for it.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: My kitty laid on my chest, and we went to sleep.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I searched the room for 20 minutes looking for my kitty.
context: I decided it was time for me to go to sleep. I started up the stairs. My kitty ran in front of me. I got into my bed and under my covers.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Samantha watched another scary movie.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Samantha learned her lesson.
context: Samantha wanted to watch a scary movie, but her mother said no. Her mother left for work, and Samantha decided to watch it anyway. The movie was so scary it gave Samantha nightmares for weeks! She wished she'd never watched it!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Katie was upset at herself for waiting until the last minute.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Katie was excited to join the team.
context: Katie had waited till the last day to write her book report. She was nervous and had to hurry. She didn't do a very good job. Her teacher gave her a bad grade.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: My teacher gave me an F for the assignment.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: My teacher gave me an A on the paper.
context: Class started in 10 minutes and I had a math assignment due. My older friend volunteered to do it for me. Unfortunately, my teacher found out about the copying. She crumbled my paper and threw it in the trash.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ethan soon became an amazing soprano.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ethan became a master at playing guitar.
context: Ethan enrolled in a singing lesson near his house. He did not have any previous experience and was nervous. His instructor was a nice lady who was a world renown singer. Ethan practiced singing the scales with her.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She asked if they could go again next week.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: She rolled her eyes as her folks rejoiced at all the neat things.
context: Sunny went with her family to a village. The village was hosting a swap meet. Her family found some great deals. Overall Sunny found the event boring.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She was standing too far away to see.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: They were deer tracks.
context: Kelly took an afternoon hike with her husband. Halfway through the hike, her husband stopped. He pointed to the ground, where several animal tracks were present. Kelly knelt down to examine the tracks more closely.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Kelly kept on walking.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: All the men think Kelly is ugly.
context: Kelly was walking down the street. She is a attractive female. However, she started to get harassed. All the men were whistling and hollering.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I woke up refreshed and well rested!
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He woke up with a terrible migraine.
context: Neil was having a great time in Athens. Then a new friend offered him a traditional drink. It was a strong spirit called ouzo. Neil had a great night drinking, but the next morning was awful.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They hated one another from the start.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Kelly and Steve had a beautiful wedding.
context: Kelly loved a boy named Steve. They spent everyday together. One day Steve asked Kelly to marry him. She said yes.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Lilly had a terrible date.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Lilly had a wonderful time.
context: On the fourth of July, Lilly baked a lemon blueberry cake. She brought it to her boyfriend's house and they had a bbq. After dinner they drove into the city to watch fireworks. When the show was over, they got donuts from a food truck.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her hands got better.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Emma threw the salve in the trash.
context: Emma had been working as a dishwasher. Her hands cracked and bled from the hot soapy water. Then her mom noticed and concocted a special salve for her. Emma used the salve every night before bed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They had a wonderful time at the restaurant.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: They both dressed wrongly for it was a nude house warming party.
context: Two friends heard about a local house-warming party. The friends couldn't decide if they should dress formally or not. One friend chose to dress in jeans and a t-shirt. The other went in a black dress.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The man quickly tried to round them all up, but it was difficult.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The man was relieved the hurricane had missed his zoo.
context: An old rich man owned an island. He built a great zoo there. The zoo had unusual animals that nobody had ever seen before. A hurricane struck the island and many of the animals were set free.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Joe arrived at school an hour before the bus did.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Joe arrived at school exhausted.
context: Joe woke up late for school. He asked his mom for a ride, but she had no time. He knew it was too late to catch the bus. He decided he had to run all the way to school!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Carl's date enjoyed the meal.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Carl was sad because his date never called him again.
context: Carl wanted to make dinner to impress the woman he was dating. He studied some recipes and planned the meal. One the big day, his nervousness caused him to switch sugar and salt. His date could barely eat one bite and Carl was crushed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jenny decided her step mother was too old for her.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jenny decided she liked her step mother.
context: One month after Jen's mom died, her father remarried. Her new stepmother was literally five Years older than her. At first, Jenny could barely stand to be around the woman. Then one night they went to dinner, and became great friends!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mill learned later that his teacher was racist.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mill was the only girl in the whole class.
context: Mill was headed to his first day of school. When he arrived to class the teacher sat him with other black kids. Mill couldn't understand why he couldn't sit up front. His teacher told him the back is the spot he belongs.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mark sprained his wrist.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mark enjoyed the trip.
context: Mark took a sick day today, he was faking it, obviously. He didn't put on anything besides socks and boxers. He was eat ice cream and sing into his brush. The first verse of his encore he slipped on the hardwood floor.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ela ate all of the chicken by herself.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The child was happy with his nuggets.
context: Ela was babysitting. Her young charge wanted chicken nuggets. Ela checked, but there were none in the freezer. She went to McDonald's and bought some nuggets.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Gina threw the poster into the trash.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gina decided she would wear more colorful clothing.
context: Gina was putting posters on her bedroom walls. There was a poster of the cool new girl group. The girls were wearing bright colorful clothing. Gina herself was wearing a brown shirt and khakis.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jake was very upset.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jake was very happy.
context: Jake was swimming in his backyard. All of a sudden his pool burst open. There was a hole on the side of his pool. All the water leaked out of the pool.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: After two weeks, she had less bloating and felt better.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Em stocked up on favorites: bacon, beer and cookies!
context: Em had had digestion issues lately. She visited her doctor. He suggested probiotics and active cultures. Em started to eat enriched yogurt every day.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Gina didn't know what she would do without her paints.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Luckily, Gina's teacher handed out new pencils that day.
context: Gina had searched for her lost pencils for days. She had even searched the bag of a boy she thought took them. She knew she couldn't ask her mother for more pencils. And she didn't have money to buy more.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Aidan enjoyed riding the bus every day.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Aidan learned a lot from his mom.
context: Aidan's family had moved to a very rural area. His parents discussed schooling options. Aidan's mom didn't want him to ride a bus for three hours every day. She decided to teach him herself.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her mom got angry.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gina threw it away.
context: Gina needed a blanket for her picnic. She wanted a red gingham one. The closest she could find was her mom's bedspread. She pulled if off the bed and took it to the yard.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Later, once Tia's kids were used to the taste, they acclimated.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Later, Tia's kids joined a rugby league with snazzy uniforms.
context: Tia decided her kids were drinking too much sugar. She decided to cut out soda pop. Instead, she began to make sugar-free Kool-Aid for them. At first they complained about the change.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ed was relieved.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ed found highschool negative.
context: Ed was nervous about starting high school. He tried to reassure himself. He showed up the first day smiling and friendly. He made lots of friends quickly.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The cat got away.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The cat was really slow.
context: My cat likes to hunt. One day my cat hunted a mouse. The mouse was really fast. The cat could not catch the mouse.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Darren felt the appointment had been a waste of time.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Darren got a lot better with treatment.
context: Darren struggled with depression. He never could shake the dark feelings he had. Finally he saw a specialist and got the help he needed. He learned that there were physiological reasons for his depression.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Now the band looks for music with xylophone arrangements.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Trevor was discouraged from playing the xylophone.
context: Trevor thought that people didn't respect the xylophone enough. He loved the high-pitched percussive tones it made. Trevor convinced a band to let him join with the xylophone. They had a top 100 hit that included xylophone on the track.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sara decided this was her new favorite coffee.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Sara hated the bitter taste of coffee.
context: Sara came back from the market. And she was eager to try the new coffee that she bought. After she finished preparing it, she drank away. Sara was amazed by how smooth and rich it tasted.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The dog ate the sandwich from my plate.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: After checking the doghouse we found the toys.
context: One summer when my girls were little, I filled a pool in our backyard. I got nice inflatable pool toys, that the girls loved playing with. We carefully put the new toys by the side of the pool at sunset. The next morning, the pool water was muddy and the toys were gone!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tom stayed inside because it was too cold outside.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Tom traded in his jacket for shorts and a t-shirt!
context: Tom worried that the winter would never end. It had been a cold February and he missed the warm weather. One day the temperature rose suddenly. Tom was so happy to see that winter was finally ending.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jim vowed never to carve pumpkins again.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jim won first prize.
context: Jim loved carving pumpkins and so he entered a carving contest. First, he bought a large pumpkin from the farmer's market. Next, he thought of and drew a design on some paper. Jim carefully carved the design onto the pumpkin.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: As she walked, Miranda decided to go to bed early from now on.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Miranda rode to school feeling wide awake.
context: Miranda went to bad late last night. As a result she ended up sleeping in. To her dismay she missed the bus. She ended up having to walk to school.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: My sister in law will make some money.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: My sister in law bought more elephants.
context: My sister in law is an elephant lover. She collected 100 elephant figurines. Lately she grew tired of her collection. She had me try to sell the figurines on eBay.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her mother took her to the emergency room to have it checked.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ana decided to spin the basketball on her finger.
context: Ana was playing basketball when her finger started hurting. An hour later, she was unable to move it. Her mother told her she was overreacting. Later that night, she was in so much pain she couldn't sleep.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Luckily Gina's dad managed to get into the car and hit the brakes.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gina then drives to Brazil for the day.
context: Gina's niece was playing in the driver's seat of her dad's car. Somehow she got the car out of park, and into reverse. The car began to roll down the driveway into the street. Everyone ran to the car to try and stop it.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I left without paying the waiter a tip.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I left the waiter a large tip.
context: At the restaurant, the waiter gave me the wrong food. I asked the waiter for the correct dinner. The waiter brought me another incorrect order! They messed up my order twice.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Jake saved up a lot of money just using his metal detector.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jake despised his metal detector.
context: Jake bought a metal detector. He took it to the beach to try it out. His metal detector found things buried in the sand. It frequently found quarters.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mr White and Mr Black invited me to their wedding.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The police came and questioned me about what I had seen.
context: I had heard Mr White and Mr Black argue for months. Today I suggested Mr Black call the police on Mr White. Mr Black said the 911 operator was sending the police. I witnessed Mr White stabbing Mr Black.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Chuck realized that it was 2 in the morning.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He was mad that he watched Breaking Bad.
context: Chuck came home from work. He turned on Netflix. His favorite show on Netflix was Breaking Bad. Chuck watched Breaking Bad for 8 hours.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: We all had a good time.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: We all had a terrible time.
context: There was a book series I loved very much. I looked forward to each new installment. When the last book came out, there was a midnight party at the store. I dressed up and went with my friends.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ross had no practice singing so his band did not get a medal.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ross and his band scored first place.
context: Ross had big dreams to be a professional singer. He joined a band as lead vocalist. He took voice lessons. One day his band tried out for a talent competition.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Gina ended up really loving the Spanish class.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Gina decided to put herself on a paleo diet.
context: It was Gina's turn to choose classes at school. She was enrolling late and there weren't many classes left. She hated the majority of what she was offered. Since she had few choices she took Spanish, and gym.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Terry doesn't have good friends.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: His friends gave him his favorite zoo cup.
context: Terry liked collecting cups with weird art on them. He went to shops and trawled for good cups. His friends gave him cups at holidays. His prized piece was a zoo cup shaped like an elephant.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Stewart and his sister were in trouble.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Stewart and his sister parents congratulated them.
context: Stewart and his sister were fighting over the TV remote. Their parents yelled at them to stop, but the kids persisted. During a tug of war over the remote, it flew out of their hands. The remote smashed into the TV screen, resulting in a big crack.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tom did a good job and his girlfriend liked the pizza.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Tom decided to make fried chicken instead.
context: Tony had the pizza ingredients ready. He never baked a pizza before. Tony wanted to surprise his girlfriend. He followed the instructions to make pizza.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Billy decided that he was sick of video games.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He played the game until bedtime.
context: Billy loved playing video games. One day he begged his parents to take him to Kmart. He saw a whole bunch of games there. He picked out a popular shooter game then took it home.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: The men realize the concierge's mistake and laugh uncomfortably.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The men fall very much in love and get married.
context: A heterosexual couple approach the checkin desk at a hotel. The woman excuses herself to go to the bathroom. A second man walks up to the desk and stands next to the first. The concierge assumes the two men are together.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Brad was ecstatic!
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Brad hated his parents.
context: Brad had just gotten his license. He asked his parents for a car for his birthday. They told him they would think about it. They then went and bought him a car.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Arnold couldn't wait to have children.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Soon they love spending time with him.
context: Arnold changed jobs to be closer to his children. His children seems very uninterested in having him around. Arnold plans more activities with his children. They begin to loosen up towards him.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They were bored because they had already been on this cruise.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: They were very excited and took lots of pictures.
context: Jenny and her boyfriend boarded the ship. They were both excited for a boat trip around the harbor. They had never seen it from the water. They set sail and began the cruise.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Battlefront is the easiest game I ever played.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The day we finally beat it was such a great day.
context: Once we got a new Xbox, we knew we needed to get Battlefront. My brother and I loved to play the game together. Although the hard level was very hard and we couldn't get past it. But we would keep playing and trying to get past the level.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Meanwhile, his friends were all unemployed.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: He went online, and researched law schools.
context: Ray went to classes to be a plumber. His friends mocked him relentlessly for his career choice. But Ray didn't let them bother him. He kept at it and soon was making $25 an hour as a plumber.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I didn't need to use my phone the whole day.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I used my phone until the battery died anyway.
context: I arrived in school and decided to head to the library. When I looked at my phone, it had ten percent of its battery left. In addition, I forgot my phone charger at home. Unless there was an emergency call, I didn't use my phone.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was really disappointed and hungrier than ever.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I enjoyed a great Chinese dinner there.
context: There was this amazing Mexican joint right by my dorm. I would walk there a few times a week and eat tacos. The best part was that they were open all night. I went down there one night I found out they closed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mary put a sweater on.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mary got a lot of positive attention.
context: Mary had lost forty pounds. She couldn't wait to go to the beach and show off! She donned her new bikini and headed to the shore. There, she strutted up and down the water's edge.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Richard and his family are very anti-American.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: They are very excited for a new life.
context: Richard lives in the Philippines with his wife and two daughters. His oldest daughter is studying to be a police investigator. His youngest daughter will graduate high school this May. Right after Micah graduates the family is moving to America.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: John had a lot of stupid fun.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: John collected the marshmallows to eat afterwards.
context: John was really bored at work one day. He decided to order a huge amount of marshmallows from online. He also bought a marshmallow gun. He spent hours shooting marshmallows at the birds outside his house.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He refused to wear it and left the hospital.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: All his friends thought his cast was cool.
context: Sam decided to go skateboarding on the street. Sam was doing well until a car swerved in front of him. Sam fell and broke his arm. Sam went to the hospital and his arm was put in a cast.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He started to enjoy himself.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: The choir decided to call the police.
context: The church choir went around town singing Christmas carols. While singing in the park, they encountered a homeless man. The homeless man seemed very annoyed with their singing. Once he heard O Holy Night, he sang along with the choir.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Her sister loved the salad.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Jane drove a car to the city.
context: Today, Jane made a salad. The salad had spinach, goat cheese and cranberries. Jane drizzled balsamic over the top. She shared her salad with her sister.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Pam got burns on her chest.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Pam took of her shirt.
context: Mike took his son Jon and daughter-in-law Pam to the shooting range. He warned them to wear clothes that covered their neck and chest. If they didn't, hot spent shell casings could fall into their collars. Pam's shirt didn't have a collar, so a bit of her chest was exposed.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: As an adult I no longer am interested in meeting a girl.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I bought oysters and champagne.
context: As a boy I really wanted to meet a girl like my mother. But as I grew I found different traits desirable. Hanging around other boys made me happy inside. I realized quite quickly that I might be gay.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: We then got a tour guide to show us around.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: We rented some bicycles and enjoyed traveling around the island.
context: We were on vacation, visiting great historical sites. On our last day we went to a mysterious island. The tour guide said this is where political dissidents were exiled. We decided to explore the island on our own, and left the tour.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I was really embarrassed they had to come.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I was happy looking at my kitchen.
context: In 1992 our condo had a kitchen fire. I was cooking a turkey. The grease in the oven caught fire. The fire department put out the fire.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Ruth became sad.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Ruth and Jane formed a rival gang.
context: Gina's friend Ruth had a friend named Jane. Gina and her other friends disliked Jane. But Ruth was always inviting Jane to do things with them. The other friends decided to stop inviting Ruth.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: She poured the contents into the garbage and washed the bowl.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Julie decided it was her new favorite food.
context: Mariko took her friend Julie to try ramen. Julie had never had ramen that wasn't instant dry noodles before. She eagerly tried the ramen. It was so good, she ordered a second bowl.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He plugged the toaster in.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Cody threw the broken toaster away.
context: Gordy tried making some toast last Tuesday morning. He wanted to have a decent breakfast for once. He waited and the bread never warmed. He finally realized that the toaster wasn't plugged in.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: I decided to play alone in my room.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: I went outside and sprayed them with the hose when they followed.
context: I was resting on my couch. My two cousins appeared out of nowhere. They raised their water guns. I immediately ran.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Mark was ashamed of his efforts.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Mark was proud of his efforts.
context: Mark had an Algebra test coming up. He wanted to get a good grade, so he studied hard every day. The day of the test came, and Mark earned an A! His hard work had paid off!

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Sam tried to send his letter again.
RandomFifthSentenceQuiz2: Sam's mother was happy that the letter never came.
context: Sam wrote a letter to his mother. He dropped off the letter in the mailbox. He was surprised to find that his mother did not receive his letter. She waited for a month for it to arrive.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Marie felt good and was not anxious anymore.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He does not watch enough TV.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Amy became happy.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: He walked away, and never looked back.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: They had fun.

RandomFifthSentenceQuiz1: Tina decided they'd eat out for dinner.
